net.sf.appia.protocols.group
Class ViewState

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.appia.protocols.group.ViewState
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Externalizable, java.io.Serializable
public class ViewState
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Externalizable

A view.
The class encapsulates all the attributes of a view.
It also provides some methods to process the view.

Version:
0.1
Author:
Alexandre Pinto
See Also:
LocalState, View, Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

ViewState

public ViewState()

ViewState

public ViewState(java.lang.String version,
                 Group group,
                 ViewID id,
                 ViewID[] previous,
                 Endpt[] view,
                 java.net.SocketAddress[] addresses)
          throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                 AppiaGroupException
Constructs a view.

Parameters:
version - the version of the view
group - the Group of the view
id - the ViewID of the view
previous - the ViewIDs of the previous views
view - the Endpts of the members of the view
addresses - the addresses of the members of the view
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if group or id or view or addresses are null
AppiaGroupException - if the sizes of view and addresses are different

next

public ViewState next(Endpt coord)
               throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                      AppiaGroupException
Creates the next ViewState.
The new ViewState mantains the same view and addresses.
The ViewID is generated using the ViewID.next(...) method.

Parameters:
coord - the Endpoint id of the coordinator of the new ViewState
Returns:
the next ViewState
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException
AppiaGroupException

remove

public void remove(boolean[] remove)
Removes the indicated members from the current ViewState.
The members whose index is at true in the remove array, are removed from the ViewState.

Parameters:
remove - the members to remove

merge

public static ViewState merge(java.util.List l)
                       throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                              AppiaGroupException
Merges the view states contained in the given list into a single view.
The view is the concatenation of the different views, according to the order provided by the list itself. The version is the smallest all the versions.

Parameters:
l - A list containing the view states to merge
Returns:
the merged view state.
Throws:
AppiaGroupException - See ViewState(String, Group, ViewID, ViewID[], Endpt[], SocketAddress[])
java.lang.NullPointerException - See ViewState(String, Group, ViewID, ViewID[], Endpt[], SocketAddress[])

merge

public void merge(ViewState vs)
Merges the given ViewState to the current ViewState.

Parameters:
vs - the ViewState to merge with the current one

getDeadMembers

public Endpt[] getDeadMembers(ViewState v)
Compares two ViewState and returns the endpoints that were lost during the view change.

Parameters:
v - The ViewState to be compared.
Returns:
Array of lost EndPt.

getNewMembers

public Endpt[] getNewMembers(ViewState v)
Compares the current ViewState with the given ViewState and returns the endpoints that are new in this view.

Parameters:
v - The ViewState to be compared.
Returns:
Array of new EndPt.

getSurvivingMembers

public Endpt[] getSurvivingMembers(ViewState v)
Compares the current ViewState with the given ViewState and returns the endpoints that are in both views.

Parameters:
v - The ViewState to be compared.
Returns:
Array of the common EndPt.
